name: HAT-P-23
scenarioDescription:
The HAT-P-23 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HAT-P-23 is a star with 0.58 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.96 times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 4 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HAT-P-23 is known to have undefined exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HAT-P-23 system


HAT-P-23 b

HAT-P-23 b was discovered by the undefined observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.02 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HAT-P-23 b is 426.12 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HAT-P-23 b is 12.218 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HAT-P-23 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HAT-P-23, which contains undefined planets and was discovered by undefined.
